title: intense & intensive
content:
1.
intense, A, 
意思有“強烈的/劇烈的”跟“熱情的/熱切的”

1.1 The fracture caused him intense pain. (骨折給他造成了劇烈的疼痛)

1.2 The heat has grown less intense. 
(沒有先前那樣熱了)

1.3 The candidate has many intense supporters. 
(這位候選人有許多熱烈的支持者)

1.4 He was young and intense, and silly, too. 
(他年輕又熱情, 也有點傻氣)



2. 
intensity, N, 
意思有“(電/熱/光/聲的)強度”跟“(思想/感情/活動的)強烈”

2.1 Light intensity is the most important environmental factor. 
(光照強度是最重要的環境因素)

2.2 The explosion was of such intensity that it was heard five miles away. 
(爆炸的威力/強度大到五英哩外都聽得到)

2.3 The strike is growing in intensity. 
(罷工日益加劇)

2.4 The poem showed great intensity of feeling. 
(這首詩表現出強烈的感情)



3.
intensify, V, 
意思“強化/增強/使變激烈”:

3.1 The war/competition intensified. 
(戰爭/競爭變得激烈了)

3.2 My first failure only intensified my desire to succeed. 
(我的初次失敗只更加強了我成功的信念)



4.
“intense” (A, “強烈的/劇烈的” + “熱情的/熱切的”)跟“intensive” (A, “加強的/密集的” + “精深的/透徹的”)的不同：

“intense”強調強度，
“intensive”強調密集程度/深入程度/徹底程度

4.1 There we received several weeks of intensive training. 
(在那裡我們受了幾星期的集中訓練)

4.2 Some books are for intensive study and some are for cursory reading. 
(有的書必須精讀，有的只要稍加涉獵即可)

4.3 Wally was now out of danger and removed from intensive care. 
(瓦利已經脫離危險, 不再需要密集/特別護理) (intensive care unit/ICU加護病房)
